verb.description: Squeeze (someone) tightly in one's arms, typically to express affection.
examples: he hugged her close to him
people kissed and hugged each other

noun.description: An act of holding someone tightly in one's arms, typically to express affection.
examples: there were hugs and tears as they were reunited

origin: Mid 16th century: probably of Scandinavian origin and related to Norwegian hugga comfort, console.
